intro: Antennaria pulcherrima subsp. pulcherrima, commonly known as the purple sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple, depending on the variety. Its leaves are typically hairy and grayish-green, adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils. It is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
